title: Capturing Jaisalmer: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: When exploring the vibrant city of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan, a visit to the iconic Jaisalmer Fort is a must. This historical site offers a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region. The fort stands as a testament to the city's cultural significance and is an essential stop for anyone seeking to immerse themselves in the authentic charm of Jaisalmer.

sources.snippet: Jaisalmer, or the ‚ÄòGolden City‚Äô, was established in the 12th century by Rawal Jaisal and has since been an epitome of Rajasthan‚Äôs rich cultural heritage. With its artistic structures, monuments of local historical significance, and abandoned villages, Jaisalmer offers a glimpse into the grandeur of this incredible state.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan

places.name: Jaisalmer Fort

reviews.text: A magnificent place meandering narrow streets packed full of history and intrigue. Lots of good views from outer walls. Cows walking through streets musicians playing in streets. Afterwards we went to outskirts of town to see sunset, although it was to right hand side of fort not behind it. Still worth it.

Wonderful fort also known as living fort. You can hire a guide if u want or you can explore it on your own. Take your time and explore slowly each and every part of the fort. You can see whole city from the top of the fort. Various small shops and markets are located around the fort prices are slightly higher than average but again you can bargain. Several eateries near the fort are a must try.

That fort was amazing! Every part of it screams history, you know? You can wander around yourself or get a guide ‚Äì I'd say go for the guide if you want the full experience. It was like 250 rupees for the guide, and then 200 per person to get into the museum and the rest of the fort. There's also a residential area and some shops where you can find cool stuff like stone utensils and camel wool fabrics.

places.address: Khejer Para, Manak Chowk, Amar Sagar Pol, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Jaisalmer Fort is a massive 12th-century fortified city with ornate Jain temples featuring idols and stone carvings. The fort, established by Rawal Jaisal, offers a glimpse into the history of the city.

sources.snippet: Perched high atop Trikuta Hill, Jaisalmer Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the city's most beloved landmarks. Constructed in 1156 AD by Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal, its golden sandstone walls glimmer with light in the sunlight, creating a magical atmosphere. Narrow alleyways, intricate Jain temples, and ornate havelis provide ample photo ops, while sunset views from its ramparts make for unforgettable views from within and sunset and sunrise, respectively!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Best Photo Spots in Jaisalmer - Blogs

sources.snippet: Located on the golden sands of the Thar Desert and resembling a huge sandcastle, Jaisalmer Fort is the epitome of Rajasthani architecture. This largest living fort in India houses around 5000 people and is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. One can enter this yellow sandstone fort from different gates ‚Äì Ganesh Pol, Suraj Pol, Bhoot Pol and Hawa Pol, the last of which leads to a big courtyard called Dussehra Chowk.
sources.shortName: 31 Places to Visit in Jaisalmer That You Can Visit in 2024

sources.snippet: Standing as a sentinel amidst the golden sands, Jaisalmer Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, exudes an air of majesty and mystique that begs to be captured through the lens. The intricate architecture, adorned with ornate carvings and honey-hued sandstone, forms a breathtaking backdrop for photographers seeking to capture the essence of Rajasthan's regal heritage.

The dune bashing was exhilarating, and the camel ride added an authentic touch to the desert experience. The camp was beautifully lit with lanterns, creating a magical atmosphere. The traditional performances were captivating, and the buffet offered a delicious variety of local dishes.

I highly recommend this desert safari camping to anyone looking for an authentic and thrilling experience. We can't wait to visit again!

The excellent experience of desert camping.

Food was very delicious, staff was very helpful and kindly.

Camel and jeep safari so amazing and night culture program was very tedisational ( kalbeliya dance, langa performance,chakri dance )

Lots of thanks Mr Poonam Singh and our team .
I am highly recommend to this company.

Thank you so much, Mr. Poonam. The experience we got from your tour. It was the most beautiful and memorable for both of us. Actually, This is my third time in Jaisalmer, but the services we got from you. I never had this kind of beautiful experience. Thanks is very small word. we are very happy with your jeep Safari. your driver are very professional and knowledgeable. The food quality was really amazing in desert. Your suggestion was very good for sleep in open desert. The owner, Poonam is very professional with the services. we was very comfortable with his service. Even the price was very reasonable. Once again, thank you so much, Mr. Poonam. We are looking forward to see you soon.üôè

places.generalDescription: Gadisar Lake, constructed in the 14th century by Rawal Gadsi Singh, is a man-made rainwater lake surrounded by small temples. It serves as a water source for the people of Jaisalmer and is known for its scenic tranquility. The lake attracts tourists and offers a peaceful retreat for architecture lovers, culture enthusiasts, and bird watchers.

sources.snippet: Situated just outside the city walls, Gadisar Lake is an artificial reservoir surrounded by temples, shrines, and ghats (steps). The serene waters of the artificial reservoir reflect its surrounding architecture into an idyllic scene perfect for photography. Boat rides at sunrise or sunset offer unique perspectives and striking reflections that attract photographers; ornate chhatris pavilions (pavilions) along its edges add charm, making Gadisar a must-visit destination to capture timeless moments!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Best Photo Spots in Jaisalmer - Blogs

sources.snippet: Laser Water Show at Gadisar Lake is one of the first and largest Laser Water Show having water screen projection mapping using 3-chip DLP projectors of 25,000 lumens. Show depicts story of founders of Jaisalmer city, Jaisalmer fort, attacks of invaders on the fort & sacrifice of brave Rajput to save their land, glimpses of other tourist locations in Jaisalmer region e.g. Tanot Mata Temple, Lodruva Temple, Laxminarayan Temple, Longowala war scenes, etc.

The Most Instagrammable Places in Jaisalmer

places.name: Gadisar Lake

reviews.text:
Gadisar Lake, Jaisalmer ‚Äì A Serene Oasis in the Golden City

Gadisar Lake, located on the outskirts of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, is one of the most picturesque and historically significant attractions of the city. This artificial lake, originally built in the 14th century by Maharawal Gadsi Singh, was once the primary source of water for the arid region. Today, it stands as a beautiful blend of history, architecture, and natural beauty, drawing tourists from all over the world.

Scenic Beauty and Atmosphere

The first thing that strikes you about Gadisar Lake is its breathtaking beauty. Surrounded by stunning yellow sandstone temples, ghats, and intricately carved chhatris (cenotaphs), the lake offers a postcard-perfect view, especially during sunrise and sunset. The calm waters of the lake reflect the golden hues of Jaisalmer's architecture, creating a mesmerizing scene.

The lake is home to a variety of migratory birds, especially during the winter season. Bird watchers can spot species like cranes, pelicans, and kingfishers, making it a paradise for nature lovers. The gentle ripples in the water, combined with the chirping of birds and the occasional sound of temple bells, create a peaceful and soothing environment.

Boating Experience

One of the highlights of visiting Gadisar Lake is the boating experience. Paddle boats and rowboats are available, allowing visitors to explore the lake at a leisurely pace. As you glide across the water, you get an up-close view of the stunning structures that surround the lake. The reflections of the chhatris and temples in the water make for some truly amazing photo opportunities.

Boating is best enjoyed during the early morning or late evening when the weather is pleasant, and the golden light enhances the beauty of the surroundings. The experience is both relaxing and romantic, making it perfect for couples, families, and solo travelers alike.

Architectural Marvels and Temples

The lake is not just a scenic spot but also a place of historical and architectural significance. The Tilon Ki Pol, an elaborately carved sandstone gateway at the entrance of the lake, adds to its charm. According to legend, this gateway was built by a royal courtesan, Tilon, despite opposition from the ruling king. It is believed that she cleverly built a temple of Lord Krishna on top of the gate, ensuring that it would never be demolished.

Several small temples and shrines dedicated to Hindu deities line the lake's periphery, adding to its spiritual aura. The intricate carvings on the sandstone structures reflect the rich craftsmanship of Rajasthan and are a testament to Jaisalmer's glorious past.

Best Time to Visit

The best time to visit Gadisar Lake is during the winter months (October to March) when the weather is pleasant and ideal for sightseeing and boating. Summers in Jaisalmer can be extremely hot, making it difficult to enjoy outdoor activities. Early mornings and evenings are the best times to experience the lake's beauty, as the golden sunlight creates a magical effect on the water and surrounding architecture.

A peaceful and scenic spot in the heart of Jaisalmer! Gadisar Lake is perfect for a relaxing boat ride, especially during sunrise or sunset. Surrounded by beautifully carved temples and ghats, it's a great place for photography and quiet reflection. A must-visit for nature lovers and those looking to unwind away from the desert heat.
Place is beautiful but needs a little maintenance. Boat ride is enjoyable. I will Recommend morning time visit

places.generalDescription: WelcomHeritage Mandir Palace is a stately palace hotel located in the heart of Jaisalmer, just a short walk from popular attractions like Jaisalmer Fort and Bhatia Market. Originally built for the royals in the 20th century, this historic hotel offers bright rooms and sophisticated suites with modern amenities. Guests can enjoy two restaurants, an outdoor pool, and onsite massages.

sources.snippet: The five-storeyed majesty of the Badal Mahal (Cloud Palace) is further enhanced by its pagoda-like Tazia Tower. Each floor of the palace has an intricately carved balcony. The Badal Palace owes its beauty to the skills of Muslim craftsmen who moulded the tower in the shape of a Tazia (a float that‚Äôs part of the procession of Muharram).

places.generalDescription: Patwon Ki Haveli, also known as Patwa Haveli, is a series of palaces from the early 1800s that have been transformed into a museum showcasing intricate carvings, furniture, and artwork. These grand havelis were built by wealthy Jain merchants during the 19th century and offer a glimpse into their lavish lifestyle.

sources.snippet: Built by wealthy Jain merchants during the 19th century, these grand havelis provide an insight into their opulent lifestyle from bygone years. From intricate carvings, beautiful facades, and ornamental balconies adorning each haveli to ornamental balconies that extend, Patwon Ki Haveli provides endless photographic opportunities. From its unique blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architectural styles - offering various opportunities for photography; to mesmerising shadows on intricately carved sandstone facades that create mesmerising effects - perfect for capturing unforgettable moments that will stand the test of time!

places.name: Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli / Patwa Haveli

reviews.text:
A Fascinating Glimpse into Jaisalmer's Heritage!

Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli is a must-visit when in Jaisalmer! This beautifully preserved haveli showcases the grandeur of Rajasthan's rich history and intricate craftsmanship. The detailed carvings, exquisite balconies, and stunning jharokhas reflect the architectural brilliance of the bygone era.

The museum inside provides insightful details about the merchant families who once lived here, along with displays of traditional artifacts and paintings. The view from the top is breathtaking, offering a panoramic sight of Jaisalmer's golden landscape.

A visit to this haveli feels like stepping back in time. If you love history and heritage, this place is definitely worth exploring !

Patwon Ki Haveli is absolutely breathtaking! The carvings on the walls and balconies are so detailed that you can spend hours just admiring the craftsmanship.

The entry fee is very minimal, and totally worth it. The best part for me was climbing up to the roof-you get an incredible view of the Jaisalmer Fort standing tall in the distance. It's one of those picture-perfect moments you'll want to capture.

The streets outside are buzzing with life, full of stalls selling colorful handicrafts and souvenirs.

Tip: Go a little early in the day before it gets too crowded, and don't miss the rooftop view!

A Fascinating Glimpse into Jaisalmer's Heritage! Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli is a must-visit when in Jaisalmer! This beautifully preserved haveli showcases the grandeur of Rajasthan's rich history and intricate craftsmanship. The detailed carvings, exquisite balconies, and stunning jharokhas reflect the architectural brilliance of the bygone era.

Museum and Artifacts: The museum inside provides insightful details about the merchant families who once lived here, along with displays of traditional artifacts and paintings. The interiors hold a treasure trove of old letters, artifacts, and remnants from the British era, offering a rare glimpse into the lifestyle, trade practices, and social dynamics of that period.

Architecture and Craftsmanship: Built in the early 19th century by the wealthy Patwa family, this haveli is a testament to their immense wealth and influence. Each of the five havelis took around 12 years to complete and showcase unparalleled craftsmanship. Remarkably, these grand structures were built without cement or iron, relying solely on the ingenious rock-locking technique-a testament to the engineering brilliance of the time. The craftsmanship is simply stunning, with detailed facades, delicate balconies, and elaborate jali work.

Visitor Experience: A visit to this haveli feels like stepping back in time. If you love history and heritage, this place is definitely worth exploring. We got a guide who took us through the haveli, explaining everything. He charged us Rs. 50, but it was absolutely worth it. It took us about 20 minutes to explore the place. The view from the top is breathtaking, offering a panoramic sight of Jaisalmer's golden landscape. Tips for Visitors: Visit early in the morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds. Don't miss the rooftop view; it's absolutely worth it! A guide or audio tour enhances the experience significantly. Try not to go on public holidays or weekends as it's crowded and one may not enjoy taking photos. The market around the haveli offers good antiques and handcrafted items, though they can be a bit pricey.

Recommendation: Patwon Ki Haveli is a true architectural marvel in the heart of Jaisalmer. It's a must-see for anyone interested in architecture and history. The haveli's beautiful courtyards, finely carved windows, and stunning interiors make it a must-visit for anyone exploring the cultural legacy of Jaisalmer. Highly recommended!

Practical Information:
Entry Fee: ‚Çπ150 per person.
Guide Fee: ‚Çπ150.
Best Time to Visit: Early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and enjoy the golden glow of the fort.
Duration: Approximately 1 hour. Washrooms: Not available.
Parking: Not available.

Enjoy your visit to this magnificent piece of history!

places.address: No. 3129, Opposite Choora Paada, Rajasthan 345001, India

sources.snippet: -This time it‚Äôs time to celebrate your life in the desert with this exciting half-day desert safari in Jaisalmer.-You will depart at around 4:30 PM from your hotel pick up service in a sedan car and then will return after sunset at around 10:30 PM on the same day.-Reach the Sam desert at around 5:00 PM, which is just 45 minutes drive from Jaisalmer.-Embark on the short camel ride and explore the beautiful dunes of Sam desert.-After the camel ride, witness one of the most beautiful sunsets behind the dunes and head to the camp.-Get a traditional welcome with arti-tikka and dhols and enjoy the refreshments like tea, coffee and snacks while you enjoy the Rajasthani folk dance and music. show-Groove to the music and enjoy a delicious authentic Rajasthani veg buffet dinner.-End your trip at around 10:30 PM and get yourself Dropped at your hotel with lots of memories. Timings: 4:30 PM - 10: 30 PMMinimum number of people required: 1
sources.shortName: 50 Places to Visit in Jaisalmer 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Jaisalmer in Rajasthan is frequented by tourists for its large stretches of desert sand. Popular Desert Safaris in Jaisalmer takes place in Sam Sand Dunes. A Jeep takes you to a point near Sam Sand Dunes (around 45km from the city) from where the camel ride starts and lasts for around 90 minutes.
sources.shortName: 31 Best Places to visit in Jaisalmer | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Desert Safari

reviews.text:
*5/5 Stars*

I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the perfect desert safari package with Desert Safari Planners, and I must say, it was an unforgettable adventure!

From the moment we arrived, the staff were helpful and welcoming, ensuring that we had everything we needed for a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The management team was skilled and efficient, taking care of every detail to ensure that our desert safari experience was nothing short of perfection.

The Jeep Safari was an adrenaline-pumping thrill ride, navigating through the sandy dunes with ease. Our driver was experienced and knowledgeable, pointing out interesting landmarks and sharing stories about the local culture.

The camel ride on the silky desert sands was a serene and peaceful experience, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. The camels were well-trained and gentle, making the ride a pleasure for all.

The delicious buffet spread was a culinary delight, with a wide variety of dishes to suit every taste and preference. The food was fresh, flavorful, and plentiful, and we enjoyed every bite.

Our bedroom and bathroom were clean, comfortable, and hygienic, with all the amenities we needed for a relaxing stay. The location of the camp was perfect, situated near the stunning Sam Sand Dunes, which offered breathtaking views and unforgettable sunsets.

Overall, our desert safari experience with Desert Safari Planners was truly exceptional. We enjoyed every moment of our stay, and we would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for a memorable and adventurous desert safari experience.

Thank you, Desert Safari Planners, for an unforgettable experience! We can't wait to come back and do it all again!
best desert safari planner in jaisalmer and he is most expirenced person in travel agent feeld good service yogi bhai

It was an Awesome experience in the desert, far enough from busy lifestyle to enjoy a ride with Camels and a nice evening with a fireplace and local cultural events in the desert. You can have your best moments of life at Jaisalmer, specially with DESERT SAFARI.
Highly recommend.

sources.snippet: Visit ‚Äú Jain Temple‚Äù Inside the Jaisalmer Fort lies Jain Temple which is a series of temples devoted to Jain Tirthankaras and can be traced back to the 12th century. The temples are known for their distinctive architectural style inspired by Dilwara Jain Temples of Mount Abu.

sources.snippet: Located within the fort, Jain Temple is an architectural beauty. For as little as Rs. 50 you can witness the elegant handiwork of the craftsmen constructed this beautiful temple.

places.name: Shri Naminath Jain Shwetambar Derasar

reviews.text:
Sri Naminath Jain Temple in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan.

Address :
Shri Naminath Bhagwan Jain Mandir, Sadar Bazar, Jaisalmer 345001.

Mulnayak 21st Tirthsnkar Sri Sri Naminath Bhagwan, brown color in padmasana posture with beautiful parikar back side.

Beautiful Architectural Swetamber Jain Temple in the center of the city with beautiful carvings inside and outside walls. Temple is dedicated to Bhagwan Shri Naminath ji. Very well maintained peaceful temple. All facilities available for darshan-puja.

How to reach :
Jaisalmer nicknamed "The Golden city", is a city and district hqrs of Jaisalmer district of Rajasthan. The town lies in the heart of the Thar Desert (the Great Indian Desert) and is also famous for Jaisalmer fort. It is well connected with roads.
Train: Jaisalmer Railway Station.
Air: Jaisalmer Airport.
Beautiful Architectural Temple in city center, Temple dedicated to God Shri Naminath ji
Moolnayak Naminathji - Light Brown color marble stone, padmasan.

places.address: WW97+FG4, Sadar Bazar, Jaisalmer, Kishan Ghat, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Zostel Jaisalmer is a laid-back hostel offering warm dorms and private rooms, perfect for travelers looking to explore the city. Situated in a prime area inside the Golden Fort, it provides stunning views of Jaisalmer. The hostel features a rooftop cafe, TV lounge, free Wi-Fi, and an on-site dining option.

sources.snippet: Located in the Golden Fort, the view from the common area of the Zostel has a great city view. It makes for one of the most Instagrammable pictures of Jaisalmer.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Places of Jaisalmer- Photo Diary

places.name: Zostel Jaisalmer

reviews.text:
Zostel Jaisalmer is one of the best locations I've been. It's located inside the Jaisalmer fort and got an amazing view of the city and the sunset. It's an open roof home built of sandstone with interesting interiors.
Food here was the best I've had during my Rajasthan trip. Be it thali, dal bhati, kher sangri, churma, what not! Even the Western food was yum! Worth the money. The cook, also the owner of the proper made sure we get the best quality and tastey food at the Zostel.
Zostel had welcoming and friendly manager. Narendra ji was the manager during my stay. He helped us plan our local sight seeing and visit to SAM. He also helped me book my bus to next destination hassle-free and was helpful with any queries.
Overall, most recommended to stay at Zostel Jaisalmer, coz of the beauty of the place, tasty food and friendly hosts!

Excellent stay here in such a magnificent setting. The location couldn't be better, the staff were friendly and welcoming, and the desert safari was excellent! The food from the cafe on the roof was superb also. Overall I would highly recommend this place.

The place is stunning, right inside the fort, and has one of the highest rooftops where you can watch an amazing sunset. The staff were super friendly and made sure we had everything we needed, always with a smile. It was a perfect mix of a beautiful view, comfort, and great service. The food is also delicious - you've got to try their Rajasthani thali, especially the dal baati.

places.address: On Fort, Vyasa Pada, Khejer Para, Manak Chowk, Amar Sagar Pol, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Restaurant The Golden Fort, also known as Sonar Quila, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in the heart of Jaisalmer. This architectural marvel boasts intricate designs, narrow alleys, and stunning viewpoints that offer photographers ample opportunities to capture the interplay of light and shadow on its sandstone walls during sunrise and sunset. The fort's bustling lanes are home to various shops, bakeries, temples, and residences.

sources.snippet: At the heart of Jaisalmer lies the awe-inspiring Golden Fort, locally known as Sonar Quila. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is a treasure trove of intricate architecture, narrow alleys, and breathtaking viewpoints. As the sun bathes the fort in a golden hue during sunrise and sunset, photographers are bestowed with a plethora of opportunities to capture the play of light and shadow on its sandstone walls.
sources.shortName: Best Photography Spots in Jaisalmer

sources.snippet: Visit the Golden Fort, Popularly known as the Golden Fort of Rajasthan, Jaisalmer Fort is set on Trikuta Hills. It was constructed by Raja Jaisal, the Rajput ruler. Its yellowish sandstone structure and golden sandndunes make it referred to as the Sonar Quila.
sources.shortName: Instagram Reels & Photography Tour With The Best Photography Spots Of Jaisalmer

places.name: Restaurant The Golden Fort

reviews.text: Great food and great staff. In the low season not much tourists and the place is basic in terms of furniture. The food and staff however are excellent and safe for western stomachs! ;-))  we had dinner twice and the stuffed tomatoes were our favourite! Reccommend when you are in Jaisalmer..

Wow, I can highly recommend the stuffed tomato curry, it was delicious along with our other dishes ordered, we left the restaurant most satiated. The atmosphere, by Western standards, is rather stark but hey, we were there for the food!

Order lal mans got a lot of hair in it. Waited almost 1 and a half hour for food. Ordered sweet and sour chicken got 1 piece chicken and rest cauliflower. This is my first time writing a review as the experience was that bad.

places.address: Fort Rd, near Gorakh Haveli, Dhibba Para, Amar Sagar Pol, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Salam Singh Ki Haweli, also known as Moti Mahal, is a stunning architectural gem in Jaisalmer. Built in 1815, this residence boasts a unique peacock-shaped roof and numerous balconies that offer breathtaking views. Along with other attractions like Bada Bagh, Jaisalmer Fort, and Gadisar Lake, it adds to the allure of the city and attracts tourists.

sources.snippet: Salim Singh ki Haveli is a beautiful edifice at the heart of the city Jaisalmer. It is one of the major tourists' attractions built in the 1815 CE and commissioned by Salim Singh, the then prime minister of the Kingdom. It also holds another beautiful name - Jahaz Mahal as the front facet of the Haveli resembles a ship stern.
sources.shortName: 31 Best Places to visit in Jaisalmer | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Salam Singh Ki Haweli (Moti Mahal)

reviews.text: It is one of the popular haveli in Jaisalmer. It is located right in the center of town where it's impossible to reach by car. Auto Riksha or walking was the only option. it was built in 19th century by Salim Singh, then Prime Minister of Jaisalmer. It is an excellent piece of Rajasthani architecture. Intricate carvings on walls and balconies are worth seeing. It's better to take a guided tour to understand the rich history behind it. It's open from  AM to 6 PM and entry fee is Rs.20 for Indians and 100 for foreigners.

Salim singh ki haveli is located in main jaislmer city & nearst Patwon ki haveli.
Salim singh was that person who ruined kuldhara village .
Salim haveli is pretty & Haveli looks like beautiful and have many "jharokhe"
Per person ticket rate- 100 ruppes.
I visited  in the morning of this haveli & enjoy outside view of salim singh haveli.
This is the 3rd most famous haveli in the jaislmer.
This is fully coloured with yellow üíõ

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME!!!
This place is by far the worst spot I visited while in Rajasthan. One would think taking 100rs as entry fee would come with some maintenance of this place.. but no, as you can see in my photos, this place is an absolute dump, trash and rubble everywhere. Not worth anyone's time.

places.address: Amar Sagar Pol, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: The Folklore Museum in Jaisalmer, located within the Jaisalmer Fort, offers a captivating journey through the heritage of Rajasthan. Founded by Dr. Nand Kishore Sharma in 1997, this museum is a treasure trove of artifacts showcasing traditional costumes, musical instruments, artworks, ancient coins, fossils, and more. Visitors can immerse themselves in the customs and traditions that define the state while enjoying an evening puppet show - a major attraction at this small yet intriguing museum.

sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Folklore Museum

reviews.text:
Finally a museum that shares the story of who and why Rajasthan was founded in the very beginning.

The museum charges nothing extra to foreigners or Indians alike but the man who owns/maintains the facility has no support from the government. As a result the displays are dated and require a lot of reading.

This is not a "ooo look! A buddha statue! Let me take a quick selfie and move on!" kind of museum. Every peice has full descriptions to its importance in Hindi and English.

I cannot say how refreshing it was to go here after so many religious museums in this part of the world.

Introduction¬†of Jaisalmer Folklore Museum

Jaisalmer Folklore Museum is situated on the banks of Garsisar Lake in the Mehar Bagh Garden, this museum was founded in the year 1984. There is a wide variety of artifacts inside the museum which offers a great experience to the visitors. Visitors will get a detailed idea about the various significant historical events on visiting the museum.
Nothing great. Costly ticket at 100 pp. Very reparative..Display.. could not see but heard good puppet shows in evening
